post: Are you a student looking to showcase your service-based project? Are you making a difference in your community? You could win up to $2,000 for your project in the MyImpact Challenge Utah State Civic Fair on April 29, 2025. MyImpact Challenge is a civic engagement contest that promotes and fosters a robust understanding of citizenship to get students active in their communities now! You must submit: Principles Essay – A 1,200-word essay on how you project advances Founding principles and civic virtues Project Report – A report of up to 2,000 words on the projects inspiration, planning, and execution. Includes at least two examples of the impact on your community. Multimedia – Photographic or video documentation of project that shows a tangible impact. Register by April 14th – dont wait! Enter today.  https://lnkd.in/eDhK6hzP.

BRI's affiliate partner History By Mail will be on this week's episode of Shark Tank. Tune in tonight! When you shop using the promo code 'BRI' a portion of your purchase goes back to BRI. Shop now,  https://lnkd.in/e5t4JYpx.  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #SharkTank

April is National Financial Literacy Month! The Bill of Rights Institute collaborated with Hoover Institution, Stanford University to create the Building Blocks of Progress curriculum in 2022. This multimedia resource explores the intersection of economics and civics, and covers the role of individuals, government, and economic principles in creating a free society. Find all lessons here:  https://lnkd.in/eUqgEpjP. The Bill of Rights Institute is able to make these market-leading resources available to educators and students thanks to the generosity of our donors.

Have you heard? Our affiliate partner, History By Mail, will be on this week's episode of SharkTank. At the Bill of Rights Institute, we are proud to partner with companies that give back to civic education. When you shop using the designated promo codes, a portion of your purchase goes back to BRI. Shop now, with code 'BRI,' v https://lnkd.in/e5t4JYpx.

Calling all teachers! Are you looking for professional development events this spring? The Bill of Rights Institute hosts PD events that combine robust educational content with an energetic community of participants. Join our sessions, now: - Online Event: Write More & Grade Less with Micro Writing Strategies, April 21 from 7:00-8:00 PM EDT - Grand Rapids, MI: Exploring Representative Government: The Constitution in Action, April 24 from 8:00-3:00 PM EDT - Online Event: What does Being an American Mean?, April 29 from 7:00-8:00 PM EDT - Reno, NV: Civil Discourse Educator Summit, May 3 from 8:00-3:00 PM EDT Want to attend? Check our events page,  https://lnkd.in/eKkSxNzF.

Are you a sophomore, junior, or senior high school student looking to participate in lively debates, public speaking training, and attend leadership workshops? Join Debate and Leadership Institute for the premier 5-day program from July 21-25, 2025 in Valley Forge, PA! Co-hosted by Founding Forward and the Bill of Rights Institute, this is an experience you won't want to miss. Register to take your debate skills to the next level, today  https://lnkd.in/erA2KXha

This year, the Bill of Rights Institute has been hard at work to ensure we are on track to reach 100,000 teachers by our nations' 250th birthday in 2026. But we've also been busy trying to answer the question: how do you create a lasting impact on the future generation of leaders? Bill of Rights Institute Vice President of Development Anthony Simone discusses the impact of supporting BRIs work in classrooms and communities nationwide, and the ways in which the Institute equips students with fundamental skills to become engaged citizens and effective employees and leaders. Watch the video, now  https://lnkd.in/eJAZHj9Q

Discover our brand-new, standards-alignment discovery tool! Now, teachers can easily explore all the BRI resources that align with their state standards for U. S. History, Government and Civics classrooms. As a national organization, the Bill of Rights Institute does not design resources specifically to meet any individual states standards. However, BRI resources are designed with practices that align with many state standards. The new tool highlights resources recommended by state educators as meeting these standards. Ready to elevate your teaching? Visit  https://lnkd.in/eX3QzmA7.

Calling all high school students who want to sharpen their debate skills! Founding Forward and the Bill of Rights Institute invites students entering grades 10-12 to register for the premiere 5-day program, Debate and Leadership Institute, in Valley Forge, PA. Co-hosted by Founding Forward and the Bill of Rights Institute, the program will challenge students to construct compelling arguments and engage in lively debatewhile building skills for the future. Don't wait! Apply today:  https://lnkd.in/erA2KXha
